intro: Bedfordia linearis subsp. linearis, commonly known as the slender bedfordia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its linear, grass-like leaves and small, white to pinkish flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in coastal or inland regions. It is a perennial herb that thrives in full sun and is known for its ornamental value in gardens. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially vulnerable species.
